DataElement.preferredName: Post Surgical Procedure Venous Thromboembolism Preventive Intervention Technique Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information regarding the technique used to prevent occlusion of the lumen of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream in the veins after a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Post Surgical Procedure Venous Thromboembolism Preventive Intervention Technique
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information regarding the technique used to prevent occlusion of the lumen of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream in the veins after a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Of, or pertaining to, or contained in, or performing the function of the veins.:Occlusion of the lumen of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream.:An attempt to prevent disease.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Concepts.definition: Of, or pertaining to, or contained in, or performing the function of the veins.
Occlusion of the lumen of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream.
Therapeutic, nutritional, environmental, social and/or behavioral interventions at the societal, community, organizational or individual levels to reduce, modify or stop the course of a disease.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to GOG for REBOYJ by script Thu Aug 1 14:45:44 EDT 2013

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: identifiable qualities of techniques used to prevent occlusion of the lumen of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream within the veins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Associated concept to VM for TCGA. mc 11/9/12 - reversed concept order to match the semantics of this phrase which is "other" with "specify" as a qualifier/modifier - DW 12-30-2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An event or action that occurs successively after another.: A machine used to keep blood and lymph flowing by pushing air through bands or sleeves that are placed on the arms or legs.

Concepts.definition: An event or action that occurs successively after another.
A system comprised of a programmable pneumatic compressor controller and appendage-specific air-chambered garments designed to stimulate the lymphatic system and treat lymphedema.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tight-fitting, elastic garment, such as a sleeve or stocking. Compression garments are used in the treatment of lymphedema (swelling caused by a buildup of lymph fluid in tissue). They are also used to improve blood flow.

Concepts.definition: A tight-fitting, elastic garment, such as a sleeve or stocking. Compression garments are used in the treatment of lymphedema (swelling caused by a buildup of lymph fluid in tissue). They are also used to improve blood flow.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

Concepts.definition: A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Of, or pertaining to, or contained in, or performing the function of the veins.:Occlusion of the lumen of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream.:An attempt to prevent disease.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Of, or pertaining to, or contained in, or performing the function of the veins.
Occlusion of the lumen of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream.
Therapeutic, nutritional, environmental, social and/or behavioral interventions at the societal, community, organizational or individual levels to reduce, modify or stop the course of a disease.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
